impact_weight: The reduction of waste can aid in the restoration of terrestrial ecosystems by decreasing pollution and preserving natural resources.
Proper management of municipal waste can create conditions for more sustainable agricultural practices, furthering the restoration of agricultural ecosystems.
Reducing food waste can limit the options for agricultural production, potentially constraining the restoration of agricultural ecosystems.
Decreasing plastic waste can reinforce the restoration of marine ecosystems by reducing pollution and protecting marine life.
Promoting circularity and recycling can aid in the restoration of terrestrial ecosystems by reducing waste and preserving natural resources.
Encouraging recycling and circularity in municipal waste management can create conditions for more sustainable agricultural practices.
The focus on recycling textile waste might constrain options for agricultural production, potentially limiting the restoration of agricultural ecosystems.
The extraction of critical raw materials can counteract efforts to restore forests, as it may lead to deforestation and habitat destruction.
The development of net-zero technology can reinforce the restoration of terrestrial ecosystems by reducing pollution and promoting sustainable practices.

source_subtheme: Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling
impact_weight: Recycling critical raw materials from batteries can create conditions for more sustainable forest management, furthering the restoration of forests.
